page.title: 19Union Chain Bridge
page.content: The bridge became the prototype for suspension bidges throughout the world. The span between the towers is 437ft. with the actual bridge being only 316ft. as the English Tower is set back into the cliff to allow the road to curve onto the bridge.The Scottish Tower is 60ft. high and has a road arch 10ft. wide and 17ft. high.The anchorages of the suspension chains are embedded into the earth on the Scottish side and into into the rock high up on the English side.Rods hang alternately from each tier of chains so that the weight of the road platform can be borne equally by all chains.The road platform is built 27ft above the normal summer level of the River Tweed;at the time of building this was 10ft. above the highest flood level,but in 1948 it was only inches.
